alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 9:51PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain over parts of southwest New Hampshire due to thunderstorms. Flooding is occurring. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Henniker, Swanzey, Winchester, Antrim, Hancock, Bradford, Dublin, Richmond and Harrisville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
